intro: Hieracium bifidum subsp. sivyense, commonly known as the Sivyan Hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing adaptability to arid conditions. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct morphological and genetic differences from other members of the *Hieracium* genus. It is often found in mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
